oai_dc:dc.dc:title: William Carroll portrait
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Bust portrait of William Carroll (1788-1844) on silk. Carroll wears a dark coat and white cravat. "Possunt Quia Posse Videntur, Virtute Ac Labore" is printed above the image. "William Carroll, Esq." is printed below.

Governor of Tennessee, 1821-1827, 1829-1835. Carroll served in the Creek War (1813-1814) was seriously wounded at the Battle of Horseshoe Bend (March 27, 1814). He served as governor of Tennessee longer than any other. The silk portrait is possibly a campaign souvenir.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Carroll, William, 1788-1844
Carroll, William, 1788-1844;Tennessee. Governor;Tennessee. Office of the Governor
